an7.35:1.1: “Mendicants, tonight a deity … said to me:
an7.35:1.2: ‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.35:1.4: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for immersion; being easy to admonish, and good friendship.
an7.35:1.5: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
an7.35:1.6: That is what that deity said.
an7.35:1.7: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
an7.35:2.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:
an7.35:2.2: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
an7.35:2.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher and praises such respect.
an7.35:2.4: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.
an7.35:2.5: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:2.10: They are personally easy to admonish …
an7.35:2.11: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an7.35:2.12: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an7.35:2.13: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:2.14: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
an7.35:3.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
an7.35:3.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher …
an7.35:3.4: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.
an7.35:3.5: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:3.10: They are personally easy to admonish …
an7.35:3.11: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an7.35:3.12: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an7.35:3.13: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:3.14: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”
